newsitem.title: UK: UK clears P&O North Sea Ferries buy.
newsitem.headline: UK clears P&O North Sea Ferries buy.

text.p: The UK government said on Thursday it has cleared the proposed purchase by shipping giant Peninsular and Oriental Steam (P&O) of a 50 percent shareholding in North Sea Ferries from Dutch Royal Nedlloyd.

P&O, which earlier this month raised the stakes in the cross-Channel passenger battle with undersea rival Eurotunnel by announcing a planned merger with its fiercest competitor Stena, said in September it would pay 25 million stg for Nedlloyd's interest in North Sea Ferries.
This acquisition is expected to generate savings of five million stg a year on a cost base of 140 million stg and cut 100 jobs by integrating functions at Europoort and Zeebrugge.
Clearance of the North Sea Ferries acquisition comes just weeks after Lord Sterling, chairman of P&O, said he believed the government would not object to the ferry venture with Stena.
